pt: {sc}odorous{/sc} {sc}fragrant{/sc} {sc}redolent{/sc} {sc}aromatic{/sc} mean emitting and diffusing scent. {sc}odorous{/sc} applies to whatever has a strong distinctive smell whether pleasant or unpleasant.
{sc}fragrant{/sc} applies to things (such as flowers or spices) with sweet or agreeable odors.
{sc}redolent{/sc} applies usually to a place or thing impregnated with odors.

pt.t: the kitchen was {it}redolent{/it} of garlic and tomatoes

pt: {sc}aromatic{/sc} applies to things emitting pungent often fresh odors.

et: Middle English, from Middle French, from Latin {it}redolent-, redolens{/it}, present participle of {it}redolēre{/it} to emit a scent, from {it}re-, red-{/it} + {it}olēre{/it} to smell {ma}{mat|odor|}{/ma}
shortdef: full of a specified fragrance : scented
